intro: Phymatodes crenulata, commonly known as the Texas starburst lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a robust root system and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments. Phymatodes crenulata is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
